title.value: Transparent Anomaly Detection via Concept-based Explanations
title.justification: The title of the paper is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Transparent Anomaly Detection via Concept-based Explanations

extractions.description: This paper introduces Transparent Anomaly Detection Concept Explanations (ACE), a framework that incorporates human-interpretable explanations into anomaly detection tasks. It aims to improve transparency and promote human-model interaction while maintaining or improving detection performance.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results to validate the effectiveness of the proposed ACE model across multiple datasets.
type.quote: We validate the performance of ACE across three realistic datasets - bird classification on CUB-200-2011, challenging histopathology slide image classification on TIL-WSI-TCGA, and gender classification on CelebA.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on anomaly detection and enhancing its explainability using concept-based explanations.
name.quote: The task of anomaly detection (AD) focuses on finding whether a given sample follows the learned distribution.

name.justification: The paper aims to make anomaly detection models explainable by incorporating human interpretable concepts.
name.quote: In many critical domains such as healthcare and finance, it is not only crucial to identify anomalies but also to provide meaningful explanations for the detected anomalies.

name.justification: One of the datasets used for validation is the CUB-200-2011, which is for bird classification, a classic computer vision task.
name.quote: We validate the performance of ACE across three realistic datasets - bird classification on CUB-200-2011.

name.justification: ACE is the newly proposed model in the paper, designed to provide interpretable explanations for anomaly detection.
name.quote: we propose Transparent Anomaly Detection Concept Explanations (ACE). ACE is able to provide human interpretable explanations in the form of concepts along with anomaly prediction.

is_contributed.justification: ACE is introduced for the first time in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: we propose Transparent Anomaly Detection Concept Explanations (ACE).

is_executed.justification: The model was implemented and tested across multiple datasets as part of the validation process.
is_executed.quote: We validate the performance of ACE across three realistic datasets - bird classification on CUB-200-2011, challenging histopathology slide image classification on TIL-WSI-TCGA, and gender classification on CelebA.

is_compared.justification: ACE's performance is compared against other black-box models based on various metrics like ROC-AUC.
is_compared.quote: We validate the performance of ACE across three realistic datasets - bird classification on CUB-200-2011, challenging histopathology slide image classification on TIL-WSI-TCGA, and gender classification on CelebA. Our results demonstrate that our concept-based explanation framework not only enhances the interpretability of anomaly detection models but also maintains competitive detection performance.
